title: How to Alternative Strum in Rock Band

steps.headline: Understand what normal strumming is.
steps.description: Normal strumming usually involves pressing down on the strum bar with your thumb to strum a note, or much more rarely, using your fingers to strum upward, like how one would play on a bass guitar.

steps.headline: Go into practice mode, and find a song with long, repetitive passages, example: Paranoid by Black Sabbath.
steps.description:
Play it just one speed notch underneath what is comfortable for you. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/b\/bc\/Alternative-Strum-in-Rock-Band-Step-2.jpg\/v4-460px-Alternative-Strum-in-Rock-Band-Step-2.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/b\/bc\/Alternative-Strum-in-Rock-Band-Step-2.jpg\/aid411126-v4-728px-Alternative-Strum-in-Rock-Band-Step-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":272,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"430","licensing":"

\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Alternative strum by strumming up and down.
steps.description: Hold the strum bar with your thumb and index fingers, and strum up and down in a pattern, typically Down Up Down Up Down Up Down Up... well, you understand.

steps.headline: Practice!
steps.description: You should always practice songs like this if you're having difficulty. Some people-like the author-are too hyper to alternative strum a song to the point of a x4 multiplier or x6 multiplier on the first try. If you're like that, Practice Mode is a must.

text:
Understand what normal strumming is. Normal strumming usually involves pressing down on the strum bar with your thumb to strum a note, or much more rarely, using your fingers to strum upward, like how one would play on a bass guitar. Go into practice mode, and find a song with long, repetitive passages, example: Paranoid by Black Sabbath. Play it just one speed notch underneath what is comfortable for you. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/b\/bc\/Alternative-Strum-in-Rock-Band-Step-2.jpg\/v4-460px-Alternative-Strum-in-Rock-Band-Step-2.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/b\/bc\/Alternative-Strum-in-Rock-Band-Step-2.jpg\/aid411126-v4-728px-Alternative-Strum-in-Rock-Band-Step-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":272,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"430","licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"} Alternative strum by strumming up and down. Hold the strum bar with your thumb and index fingers, and strum up and down in a pattern, typically Down Up Down Up Down Up Down Up... well, you understand. Practice! You should always practice songs like this if you're having difficulty. Some people-like the author-are too hyper to alternative strum a song to the point of a x4 multiplier or x6 multiplier on the first try. If you're like that, Practice Mode is a must.
